revised_title: Anatomical Investigation of Cerebral Hemispheres Connectivity
tldr: The author investigates the structure and connectivity of the cerebral hemispheres, focusing on the course of fibers connecting convolutions and the extent of commissural communication between different parts of the hemisphere. The study reveals that commissural fibers are more extensive than previously described, and that many convolutions have no direct connection with the crus, central ganglia, or corpus callosum.
